algorithm_technique: Use a modified QuickSelect (nth_element) algorithm to find the k-th largest element based on string length and lexicographical order.
problem_summary_simple: Find the k-th largest integer represented as strings in an array.
problem_summary_technical: Employ QuickSelect with a custom comparison function that prioritizes length, then lexicographical order for strings representing numbers.
time_complexity: O(n) on average, O(n^2) worst case
key_insights: The comparison of numbers represented as strings needs to consider both length and lexicographical order.
QuickSelect (or `nth_element`) is an efficient algorithm for finding the k-th element without full sorting.
A randomized pivot selection helps to achieve the average O(n) time complexity.
